content: Composite restorations (tooth-colored fillings) involve the removal of decayed tooth structure followed by placement of a tooth-colored resin material. This material is bonded to the tooth using adhesive systems and then cured with a blue light. Indications include small to moderate sized carious lesions, especially in areas where aesthetics is a concern.
reference: Sturdevant's Art and Science of Operative Dentistry, 7th Edition
